newsitem.title: UK: Baird upbeat after restructuring hits profit.
newsitem.headline: Baird upbeat after restructuring hits profit.

text.p: British clothing designer and manufacturer William Baird Plc said on Tuesday that order levels and sales were in line with expectations and that it was confident of further progress this year.

The company unveiled pre-tax profits for 1996 of 25.1 million stg before exceptional restructuring costs from 20.1 million previously. After costs it suffered a pre-tax loss of 6.0 million versus a 10.3 million gain.
"Economic recovery in the UK, which is further advanced than that in continental Europe, is resulting in a more favourable trading environment," said the company.

Baird launched a restructuring programme in October 1996 designed to focus on marketing its own branded clothing and on designing and manufacturing for Marks & Spencer Plc, resulting in costs of 31.1 million stg.
The company recently sold five clothing and gift businesses for 23 million stg to a company owned by 3I Group Plc and investment funds as part of the restructuring.
It maintained its dividend at 9.35p per share. By 1056 GMT, shares in the firm had risen 1-1/2p to 184-1/2.
